Articles.Content:
So I have a strange bug that causes Duna's surface to be bright red, like REALLY bright red. I'm not sure which mod causes it so that's why I'm asking here and I know that it's a mod because Duna is back to normal on a stock install. Not sure if I followed the guidelines correctly but here's what I have.

KSP: 0.90 Windows 32-bit ALSO USING OPENGL. My KSP RAM is usually at 2.5gb.

Problem: Very bright Duna surface

Mods installed: Very long list so I just took a screenshot

Some mods that are inside folders are:

Astronomer's Interstellar Pack

The KerbTown folder is just KerbalKonstructs buildings

HGR is just the IVA props for Snack Pack

Kopernicus is just OuterPlanets.

Reproduction steps: I guess just load up KSP with these mods? I'm not sure how to reproduce it since it happens to me everytime.

Log: https://www.dropbox.com/s/99tbgd87oxr1eec/output_log.txt?dl=0

Edited February 23, 2015 by tygoo7
Im not even sure what half those mods do, but it could be enviromental visual enhancements. Delete or remove that and see if it works. If it does, its a visual enhancements bug, if not I dont know.

Im not even sure what half those mods do, but it could be enviromental visual enhancements. Delete or remove that and see if it works. If it does, its a visual enhancements bug, if not I dont know.

I just tried it with EVE uninstalled and it still is very bright...this is very strange. I wonder if I verify the game cache or whatever that steam thing is, will fix this.

EDIT: Nope, still nothing.

Edited February 23, 2015 by tygoo7

How about planetshine?

What other visual effect mods (besides the collision ones) are in there?

How about planetshine?

What other visual effect mods (besides the collision ones) are in there?

That worked, I think. It's not pure red/orange anymore so that's good. Not sure if it's normal yet since I haven't been to Duna much. I think it's back to normal, but I just want to make sure.

I have Texture Replacer, EVE (not the problem), Hot Rockets, Smokescreen. That's pretty much my visual effect mods.
Looks okay. Maybe a little on the bright side, but could just be one of the lighter areas.

Looks okay. Maybe a little on the bright side, but could just be one of the lighter areas.

Alright, thanks for the help. Here's some rep!
